thread.title: US IG CLOSE-Five high-grade issuers raise US$6.65bn
thread.title_full: US IG CLOSE-Five high-grade issuers raise US$6.65bn

title: US IG CLOSE-Five high-grade issuers raise US$6.65bn
text:
+0.15 
By Mike Gambale 
NEW YORK, Aug 4 (IFR) - Below is a recap of primary issuance activity in the US high-grade market on Tuesday: 
Number of deals priced: 5 
Total (Swiss: FP.SW - news ) issuance volume: US$6.65bn 
Average new issue concession: 6.30 
Average book to cover: 2.88 
PHILIP MORRIS INTERNATIONAL INC (Xetra: A0NDBJ - news ) 
Philip Morris International Inc. (PM), A2/A/A, announced a US$1bn SEC registered 2-part senior note offering that includes a 2-year (8/11/2017) and 10-year (8/11/2025). Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) , BNP (Paris: FR0000131104 - news ) Paribas and SocGen (Paris: FR0000130809 - news ) are the active bookrunners. UOP: GCP, which may include repayment/refinance of debt and to repurchase common stock. Settle: 8/11/2015. 
IPT: 2yr T+80bp area, 10yr T+140-145bp 
PRICE GUIDANCE: 2yr T+65-70bp, 10yr T+130bp area (+/- 2bp) 
LAUNCH: US$1.25bn 2-part. US$500m 2yr at T+65bp, US$750m 10yr at T+128bp. 
PRICED: US$1.25bn 2-part total. 
- US$500m 1.25% cpn 2yr (8/11/2017). At 99.748, yld 1.378%. T+65bp 
- US$750m 3.375% cpn 10yr (8/11/2025). At 99.028, yld 3.491%. T+128bp. 
BOOK: US$3.4bn total 
NIC (NasdaqGS: EGOV - news ) : 2-year: 4bp (vs. 1.875% '19s at G+71bp, subtract 10bp for difference in curve, FV=G+61bp) 
10-year: 7bp (vs. 3.25% '24s at G+114bp, add 7bp for maturity extension, FV=G+121bp) 
COMPS: 
PM 1.250% November 9, 2017 at G+56bp 
PM 1.875% January 15, 2019 at G+71bp 
PM 3.250% November 10, 2024 at G+114bp 
COLGATE-PALMOLIVE CO 
Colgate-Palmolive Co, Aa3/AA-, announced a US$500m SEC registered 30-year (8/15/2045) senior unsecured notes. The active bookrunners include Bank of America (Swiss: BAC.SW - news ) , Citigroup (NYSE: C - news ) and Morgan Stanley. The notes contain a MWC. Use of Proceeds: GCP, including the retirement of commercial paper. Settlement: T+3, 08/07/2015. 
IPTs: T+125-130bp 
PRICE GUIDANCE: T+112.5bp area (+/- 2.5bp) 
LAUNCH: US$600m (upsized from US$500m) at T+110bp 
PRICED: US$600m 4.0% cpn (8/15/2045). At 99.756, yld 4.014%. T+110bp. MWC+20bp. 
BOOK: US$1.2bn 
NIC: 30-year: 10bp (vs. PG 5.55% '37s at T+104bp, add 7bp for maturity extension, FV=T+111bp. Subtract 11bp for high dollar price, FV=T+100bp) 
COMPS: 
PG (Aa3/AA-) 5.550% March 5, 2037 at T+104bp (US$123) 
MMM (Aa3/AA-) 3.875% June 15, 2044 at T+108bp 
NKE (A1/AA-) 3.625% May 1 2043 at T+110bp 
JNJ (Aaa/AAA) 4.500% December 5, 2043 T+102bp 
XOM (Aaa/AAA) 3.567% March 6, 2045 at T+105bp 
HSBC USA INC 
HSBC USA Inc, announced a US$ benchmark SEC registered 3-part senior note offering. HSBC is sole books on the deal. UOP: general corporate purposes, which may include investments in and advances to affiliates or subsidiaries, including HSBC Bank USA, National Association. 
IPTs: 3yr FXD T+110-115bp, 3yr FRN Libor equiv, 5yr T+125-130bp 
PRICE GUIDANCE: 3yr FXD T+105bp area (+/- 5bp), 3yr FRN Libor equiv, 5yr T+120bp (+/- 3bp) 
LAUNCH: US$2.7bn 3-part. US$850m 3yr FXD at T+100bp, US$250m 3yr FRN at 3mL+77bp, US$1.6bn 5yr at T+117bp. 
PRICED: US$2.7bn 3-part total. 
- US$850m 2.0% 3yr (8/07/2018) FXD. At 99.829, yld 2.059%. T+100bp 
- US$250m 3yr (8/07/2018) FRN. At 100, floats at 3mL+77bp 
- US$1.6bn 2.75% cpn 5yr (8/07/2020). At 99.912, yld 2.769%. T+117bp. 
BOOK: US$4.3bn 
NIC: 3-year: 10bp (vs. 1.7% '18s at G+85bp, add 5bp for maturity extension, FV=G+90bp) 
5-year: 12bp (vs. 2.35% '20s at G+100bp, add 5bp for maturity extension, FV=G+105bp) 
COMPS: 
1.700% March 5, 2018 at G+85bp 
2.350% March 5, 2020 at G+100bp 
NORTHERN STATES POWER CO 
Northern States Power Co (XEL), Aa3/A/A+ announced a US$600m (no grow) SEC registered 2-part first mortgage bond that includes a 5-year (8/15/2020) and 30-year (8/15/2045). Active bookrunners include BNP Paribas (Xetra: 887771 - news ) , Bank of NY Mellon, Morgan Stanley, Mitsubishi and Mizuho. Co-Managers: LOOPCM, PNC. 
Optional Redemption: Par Call: 1 month prior to maturity on the 5yr. Par Call: 6 month prior to maturity on the 30yr. Use of Proceeds: General corporate funds and apply a portion of such net proceeds to the repayment of short-term debt borrowings and to fund the repayment or redemption of our outstanding long-term debt, including the maturity of $250 million aggregate principal amount of 1.95% first mortgage bonds due August 15, 2015. Settlement T+5 (Aug 11, 2015). 
IPTs: 5yr T+80-85bp, 30yr T+135bp area 
PRICE GUIDANCE: 5yr T+70bp area, 30yr T+125bp area. Area is +/- 5bp 
LAUNCH: US$600m 2-part. US$300m 5yr at T+65bp, US$300m 30yr at T+120bp 
PRICED: US$600m 2-part total. 
- US$300m 2.20% cpn 5yr (8/15/2020). At 99.816, yld 2.239%. T+65bp. 1st pay: 2/15/2016. 
- US$300m 4.0% cpn 30yr (8/15/2045). At 98.367, yld 4.095%. T+120bp. 1st pay: 2/15/2016. 
BOOK: US$2.5bn 
NIC: 5-year: 2bp (vs. 4.125% '44s at T+113bp, 10/30s curve worth 20bp, FV=93bp. 5/10s curve worth 30bp, FV=G+63bp) 
30-year: 7bp (vs. 4.125% '44s at T+113bp) 
COMPS: 
XEL 4.125% 2044 at T+113bp 
PUBLIC SERVICE COLORADO 
XEL (A1/A/A+) 2.900% 2025 at G+98bp 
PUBLIC SERVICE COLORADO 
XEL (A1/A/A+) 4.300% 2044 at G+129bp 
3M CO 
3M Co (MMM), Aa3/AA-, announced a US$ benchmark SEC registered 3-part MTN that includes a 3-year (8/07/2018), 5-year (8/07/2020) and 10-year (8/07/2025) senior unsecured notes. The active books include Bank of America, Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS-PB - news ) and JPMorgan (LSE: JPIU.L - news ) . The notes contain a MWC. UOP: GCP. Settle: 8/07/2015. 
IPTs: 3yr T+45-50bp, 5yr T+65bp area, 10yr T+95bp area 
PRICE GUIDANCE: 3yr T+40bp area (+/- 2bp), 5yr T+55bp area (+/- 3bp), 10yr T+85bp area (+/- 3bp) 
LAUNCH: US$1.5bn 3-part. US$450m 3yr at T+38bp, US$500m 5yr at T+52bp, US$550m 10yr at T+82bp. 
PRICED: US$1.5bn 3-part total. 
- US$450m 1.375% cpn 3yr (8/07/2018). At 99.822, yld 1.436%. T+38bp 
- US$500m 2.0% cpn 5yr (8/07/2020). At 99.424, yld 2.122%. T+52bp 
- US$550m 3.0% cpn 10yr (8/07/2025). At 99.615, yld 3.045%. T+82bp. 
BOOK: US$3.65bn total; 3yr US$1.1bn, 5yr US$1.25bn, 10yr US$1.3bn 
NIC: 3-year: 4bp (3/5s curve worth 15bp, FV=G+34bp) 
5-year: 3bp (vs. 1.625% '19s at G+49bp) 
10-year: 4bp (vs. 3.875% '44s at T+108bp, 10/30s curve worth 30bp, FV=G+78bp) 
COMPS: 
1.625% June 15, 2019 at G+49bp 
3.875% June 14, 2044 at T+108bp (Reporting by Mike Gambale; editing by Shankar Ramakrishnan)
